Goats are probably one of the earliest animals domesticated (made friendly to humans).
Goats are a cloven footed animal, like the camel and the pig. That means their feet are split down the middle.
Most goats are descended from a goat in the Capra species, and come from mostly Eastern Europe, Asia and Africa.
A goat is a member of the Bovidae family, which mainly consists of goats and antelopes.
The sound a goat makes is called a bleat, and they can range from small sounds to loud screams.
The goat is a hardy animal, and good health is the rule in herds that are well managed
Goats are another animal with negative symbolic connotations.
The Greek half-man/half-goat God Pan was probably an early inspiration for the later Christian image of the devil as a half-man/half-goat.
In Christianity, goats represent the damned and sheep represent the saved.
Medieval European depictions of the goat represented it as the devil, and goats were thought to be witches' familiars.
Goats are typically gendered male, and often are said to represent uncontrolled male sexuality.

The goat is also very well adapted to various extreme environmental and nutritional conditions (climate, food resources, etc.). Furthermore, it is a relatively long-living, multiparous animal with a short generation interval
